cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the Louisiana coast, then forecast to turn north and move inland across Louisiana into Arkansas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast near Cameron–Morgan City corridor

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Cameron LA to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cameron LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River MS/LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Texas coast eastward across all of Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Wednesday into early Thursday with gusts higher.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 1–3 ft possible along the southwest Louisiana coast including the Calcasieu Pass entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with isolated pockets up to 6 inches, producing localized freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday night; brief reduced visibility and lightning affecting navigation.
